featured.text: Most styes heal on their own within a few days.
An eye stye is a small bump, resembling a pimple, that develops when an oil gland at the edge of an eyelid becomes infected by bacteria.
Pus will build up in the center of the stye, causing a yellowish spot.
Make sure you don’t squeeze or pop a stye like you would a pimple.

other.text: 19 a stye can look unpleasant at times, it is usually harmless and doesn’t cause vision problems.
Usually a stye is accompanied by a swollen eye.
These 17 are probably the beginning of an eye stye.

definition.zh_def: 眼瞼上的小腫塊，通常由感染引起。
definition.en_def: A small, painful lump on the eyelid caused by an infection of the oil glands.
definition.example: She developed a stye on her eyelid that made it difficult to see.
